content:
Imagine you are a robot browsing the web, just like humans. Now you need to complete a task. In each iteration, you will receive an Observation that includes a screenshot of a webpage and some texts. This screenshot will feature Numerical Labels placed in the TOP LEFT corner of each Web Element.
Carefully analyze the visual information to identify the Numerical Label corresponding to the Web Element that requires interaction, then follow the guidelines and choose one of the following actions:
1. Click a Web Element.
2. Delete existing content in a textbox and then type content. 
3. Scroll up or down. Multiple scrolls are allowed to browse the webpage. Pay attention!! The default scroll is the whole window. If the scroll widget is located in a certain area of the webpage, then you have to specify a Web Element in that area. I would hover the mouse there and then scroll.
4. Wait. Typically used to wait for unfinished webpage processes, with a duration of 5 seconds.
5. Go back, returning to the previous webpage.
6. Google, directly jump to the Google search page. When you can't find information in some websites, try starting over with Google.
7. Answer. This action should only be chosen when all questions in the task have been solved.

Correspondingly, Action should STRICTLY follow the format:
- Click [Numerical_Label]
- Type [Numerical_Label]; [Content]
- Scroll [Numerical_Label or WINDOW]; [up or down]
- Wait
- GoBack
- Google
- ANSWER; [content]

Key Guidelines You MUST follow:
* Action guidelines *
1) To input text, NO need to click textbox first, directly type content. After typing, the system automatically hits `ENTER` key. Sometimes you should click the search button to apply search filters. Try to use simple language when searching.  
2) You must Distinguish between textbox and search button, don't type content into the button! If no textbox is found, you may need to click the search button first before the textbox is displayed. 
3) Execute only one action per iteration. 
4) STRICTLY Avoid repeating the same action if the webpage remains unchanged. You may have selected the wrong web element or numerical label. Continuous use of the Wait is also NOT allowed.
5) When a complex Task involves multiple questions or steps, select "ANSWER" only at the very end, after addressing all of these questions (steps). Flexibly combine your own abilities with the information in the web page. Double check the formatting requirements in the task when ANSWER. 
* Web Browsing Guidelines *
1) Don't interact with useless web elements like Login, Sign-in, donation that appear in Webpages. Pay attention to Key Web Elements like search textbox and menu.
2) Vsit video websites like YouTube is allowed BUT you can't play videos. Clicking to download PDF is allowed and will be analyzed by the Assistant API.
3) Focus on the numerical labels in the TOP LEFT corner of each rectangle (element). Ensure you don't mix them up with other numbers (e.g. Calendar) on the page.
4) Focus on the date in task, you must look for results that match the date. It may be necessary to find the correct year, month and day at calendar.
5) Pay attention to the filter and sort functions on the page, which, combined with scroll, can help you solve conditions like 'highest', 'cheapest', 'lowest', 'earliest', etc. Try your best to find the answer that best fits the task.

Your reply should strictly follow the format:
Thought: {Your brief thoughts (briefly summarize the info that will help ANSWER)}
Action: {One Action format you choose}
Confidence: {A float between 0 and 1 indicating your confidence level in the action. A higher value means greater confidence.}
Completion: {A float between 0 and 1 indicating how much of the task has been completed until now. Zero means no progress has been made and one means full completion.}

Then the User will provide:
Observation: {A labeled screenshot Given by User}

Now given a task: Check the Apple Store for the availability of the latest iPhone model and schedule an in-store pickup at the nearest Apple Store for January 10, 2024.  Please interact with https://www.apple.com/ and get the answer.Observation: A screenshot and some texts. (Omitted in context.)

Thought: The latest iPhone model is prominently displayed as "iPhone 17 PRO". To check for its availability and schedule an in-store pickup, I should navigate to the "iPhone" section of the Apple Store website.
Action: Click [6]
Confidence: 1.0
Completion: 0.2
Observation: A screenshot and some texts. (Omitted in context.)

Thought: The iPhone 17 Pro is the latest model and is available for pre-order. To check availability and schedule an in-store pickup, I should select the "iPhone 17 Pro" option to proceed to its product page and view pickup options.
Action: Click [17]
Confidence: 1.0
Completion: 0.3
Observation: A screenshot and some texts. (Omitted in context.)

Thought: I have selected the iPhone 17 Pro, but I do not see options to check availability or schedule an in-store pickup yet. I need to scroll down on the product page to find purchasing or pickup options.
Action: Scroll WINDOW; down
Confidence: 0.95
Completion: 0.35
Observation: A screenshot and some texts. (Omitted in context.)

Thought: The "Pre-order" button for iPhone 17 Pro is visible. Clicking this will likely take me to the next steps for checking availability and scheduling in-store pickup.
Action: Click [0]
Confidence: 1.0
Completion: 0.5
Observation: A screenshot and some texts. (Omitted in context.)

Thought: I am on the pre-order page for the iPhone 17 Pro. I need to scroll down to proceed with the purchase or pickup scheduling, as the current screen does not display any options or forms for selecting an in-store pickup or checking store availability.
Action: Scroll WINDOW; down
Confidence: 0.98
Completion: 0.55
Observation: A screenshot and some texts. (Omitted in context.)

Thought: There is an option labeled "Pick up from Store" at the top right, which is likely relevant for scheduling an in-store pickup. I should click this to proceed with store pickup availability.
Action: Click [6]
Confidence: 0.97
Completion: 0.7
Observation: A screenshot and some texts. (Omitted in context.)

Thought: After selecting "Pick up from Store," I see options for iPhone 17 Pro and iPhone 17 Pro Max. The current selection appears to be the iPhone 17 Pro, and now I need to proceed with color selection as part of the configuration before checking pickup dates.
Action: Click [18]
Confidence: 0.95
Completion: 0.75
Observation: A screenshot and some texts. (Omitted in context.)

Thought: The color "Silver" for the iPhone 17 Pro has been selected. I need to continue with the configuration process, which will likely involve scrolling down to choose other specifications (like storage) and then checking for in-store pickup dates.
Action: Scroll WINDOW; down
Confidence: 0.97
Completion: 0.8
Observation: A screenshot and some texts. (Omitted in context.)

Thought: The storage selection is now visible, with 256GB as the base option. Selecting this allows me to proceed with a standard configuration, which should lead to the next step towards scheduling an in-store pickup.
Action: Click [1]
Confidence: 0.97
Completion: 0.85
Observation: A screenshot and some texts. (Omitted in context.)

Thought: The 256GB storage option is now selected. To proceed towards scheduling an in-store pickup, I should scroll down to access the next steps or configuration options, possibly prompting for location or date selection for pickup.
Action: Scroll WINDOW; down
Confidence: 0.97
Completion: 0.88
Observation: A screenshot and some texts. (Omitted in context.)

Thought: The trade-in section is visible, but this is optional. To continue with the process toward pickup scheduling, I should scroll further down to access the checkout or pickup scheduling options.
Action: Scroll WINDOW; down
Confidence: 0.98
Completion: 0.9
Observation: A screenshot and some texts. (Omitted in context.)

Thought: The payment and carrier selection sections are visible, but scheduling in-store pickup or verifying availability is likely further down the page after completing these selections. I should scroll further down to proceed to the pickup or availability scheduling options.
Action: Scroll WINDOW; down
Confidence: 0.98
Completion: 0.92
Observation: A screenshot and some texts. (Omitted in context.)

Thought: The AppleCare coverage options are currently displayed, which are part of the configuration process. To reach the in-store pickup scheduling and availability options, I need to scroll further down past the AppleCare section.
Action: Scroll WINDOW; down
Confidence: 0.98
Completion: 0.94
Observation: A screenshot and some texts. (Omitted in context.)

Thought: The configuration is complete, and the "Continue" button is visible, which should move me to the next step—likely store selection and pickup scheduling. I should click "Continue" to proceed.
Action: Click [1]
Confidence: 1.0
Completion: 0.96
Observation: A screenshot and some texts. (Omitted in context.)

Thought: The "Continue" button is still present and active; clicking it should move forward to the next step, potentially to store location and in-store pickup scheduling.
Action: Click [1]
Confidence: 1.0
Completion: 0.97
Observation: A screenshot and some texts. (Omitted in context.)

Thought: The screen has not changed from the previous step—indicating the "Continue" button may not be active or further action is required elsewhere before proceeding. I should check if the page is fully loaded or if there’s a missing selection by scrolling a bit to ensure no additional prompts are hidden above or below.
Action: Scroll WINDOW; up
Confidence: 0.85
Completion: 0.97
Observation: A screenshot and some texts. (Omitted in context.)

Thought: The page is prompting for an AppleCare coverage selection before proceeding. Selecting "No AppleCare coverage" will allow me to continue with just the iPhone purchase and move forward to pickup scheduling.
Action: Click [3]
Confidence: 0.98
Completion: 0.98
